title: HTML Forms Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of HTML forms and input elements

questions.question: What does the <form> tag do in HTML?
choices: Wraps input elements and handles data submission
questions.explanation: The <form> element is the container that defines where user input goes and how it’s submitted (via action and method).

questions.question: What’s the difference between the ‘get’ and ‘post’ methods?
choices: ‘get’ hides data, ‘post’ shows data in the URL
‘get’ shows data in the URL, ‘post’ hides it in the request body
questions.explanation: Use ‘get’ for public searches (non-sensitive), and ‘post’ for private info like passwords.

questions.question: Which input type hides characters as you type (e.g., for passwords)?
questions.explanation: type="password" masks characters visually — but remember, real security happens on the server.

questions.question: What’s the main difference between radio buttons and checkboxes?
choices: Radio buttons allow one choice; checkboxes allow multiple
questions.explanation: When multiple radio buttons share the same name, only one can be selected — perfect for ‘choose one’ options.

questions.question: What does the <label> tag do in a form?
choices: Connects readable text to an input (and makes it clickable)
questions.explanation: Labels improve accessibility — clicking the text focuses the input it’s linked to via for="id".
